commercial_summary: EV Charge SF offers up to $120,000 in financial incentives to install EV chargers and related infrastructure for multifamily, not-for-profit, and small business cleanpowersf properties.

residential_level_2_eligibility: Must be installed at applicant’s residence serviced under riverside public utilities territory. Level 2 charger must be a new unit. Level 2 (240v) chargers must be equipped with the sae j1772 standard or tesla connector plug and certified by a nationally recognized testing laboratory (or nrtl). All level 2 (240v) chargers must be wall-mounted at the electrical service address provided in the rebate application. An electrical permit from the city of riverside’s building and safety division is required for the installation of a hard-wired ev charger or new/modified 240v power socket. Applicants that utilize an existing 240v power socket are responsible to ensure the existing socket is compatible with the charger plug type and loading requirements. An existing or new 240v outlet is not eligible for incentives. Plug in chargers are eligible for incentives. Maximum of one (1) ev charger rebate per household every three (3) years.
residential_summary: Riverside Public Utilities offers a rebate of up to $500 for residential customers who install a new Level 2 EV charger at their home.

program_name: Public Access Electric Vehicle Charger Rebate
commercial_level_2_eligibility: Must be an active Riverside Public Utilities electric commercial customer and the EV charger must be installed at the service address. The charger must be new, not portable, resold, rebuilt, received from warranty insurance claims, or won as a prize. An electrical permit from the City of Riverside's Building and Safety Division is required for the installation of a hard-wired EV charger or new/modified 240 v power socket.  Applicants that utilize an existing 240v power socket are responsible to ensure the existing socket is compatible with the charger plug type and loading requirements.
commercial_dc_fast_eligibility: Must be an active Riverside Public Utilities electric commercial customer and the EV charger must be installed at the service address.  The charger must be new, not portable, resold, rebuilt, received from warranty insurance claims, or won as a prize. An electrical permit from the City of Riverside's Building and Safety Division is required for the installation of a hard-wired EV charger or new/modified 240 v power socket. Applicants that utilize an existing 240v power socket are responsible to ensure the existing socket is compatible with the charger plug type and loading requirements.  Must be publicly accessible during regular business hours and have a minimum of 2 charging ports.
commercial_summary: Riverside Public Utilities offers a rebate of up to $5,000 per charging station for commercial customers who install Level 2 chargers at public access locations, and up to $10,000 for DC fast chargers at schools, qualified affordable housing developments, or publicly accessible locations.
The Electrify Santa Monica program offers up to $1,500 to install an EV charging station at your multi-family building or small business.

residential_level_2_eligibility: Residents of multi-family buildings (3 or more units) and small businesses
residential_summary: Up to $1,000 is available to help residents of multi-family buildings (3 or more units) and small businesses install chargers. Low-income applicants are eligible for up to $3,000, which covers the full cost of most residential EV charger installations. Rebates may be applied to both the charging equipment and installation costs. The maximum rebate per building is $5,000.

residential_level_2_eligibility: Limit one rebate per AMP account.
residential_summary: Purchase a level 2 electric vehicle (EV) charger at home and receive a rebate worth up to $500.

program_name: City of Lodi EV Charger Rebates
commercial_summary: The City of Lodi offers rebates for the purchase and installation of Level 2 and DC Fast chargers up to $4000 for commercial and multi-family properties.
residential_summary: The City of Lodi offers rebates for the purchase and installation of Level 2 chargers for residential properties up to $750, including income-qualified residents.

residential_level_2_eligibility: Customers who install an Energy Star® Level 2 (240) EV charger in their residence.
residential_summary: Residential customers who install an Energy Star® Level 2 EV charger are eligible for a $150 rebate.

commercial_panel_upgrade_rebate: Up to $3,000 for the first building, up to $1,500 for each additional building
commercial_summary: Commercial properties can receive up to $3,000 for electrical panel upgrades, with additional buildings receiving up to $1,500 each.
residential_summary: Residential properties can receive up to $500 for electrical panel upgrades that increase capacity above 100 amps.
